intro: Phacelia pinkavae, commonly known as the Pinkavae phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-to-purple flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. Phacelia pinkavae is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
